comment.body: Hmm...isn't this a bit risky? Is there no way someone could spec say "pss3196" or so?

pull_request.title: update the composite to draft-ietf-lamps-pq-composite-sigs-02
pull_request.body:
Added changes to composite that implement the changes from draft-ietf-lamps-pq-composite-sigs-02.

- MLDSA44-RSA2048-PSS-SHA256 (mldsa44_pss2048) now uses a salt length of 256 instead of 512.
- Change references pointing at new version of the draft.

comment.body:
Yes, if someone added pss3196 it would trigger that condition, but this is only for composite and for composite there is no other pss implementation defined that starts with 3. 
Someone could add a "custom" composite but that wouldn't pass interop.
Regardless, to make it more safe I'll change this condition and add a error in case something different from 3072 or 2048 is passed.
